heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 31.1m lower than yesterday, 247.3m higher than the past week, 97.1m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 789m to a maximum of 2540m, averaging 1440.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1192.9m and 1343.1m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and bright intervals likely. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (89%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
